javabikes

Class Invoice

  • java.lang.Object
    • javabikes.Invoice

  • public class Invoice
extends java.lang.Object
    This class represents an invoice. An invoice object is created only if the customer completes the booking and the payment of a bike.

    • Constructor Detail

      • Invoice

        Invoice(Bike currentBike,
        Customer currentCustomer,
        CreditCard currentCard,
        java.lang.Boolean electricOrNot)
        Constructor of the Invoice object. It just creates a long string which is the invoice itself, with different data - depending on the customer choices.

        The invoice is created through a basic template, filled with information provided by the parameters of the constructor. Almost all the data are retrieved through the appropriate getters (for example, currentBike.getColor()); only the electricOrNot value is "translated" from a true/false value to a yes/no string. The date and time are retrieved from the Java's Date() object.
        Parameters:
        currentBike - a Bike object, representing the bike chosen by the customer.
        currentCustomer - a Customer object, representing the customer that is associated with this invoice.
        currentCard - a CreditCard object, representing the credit card that the customer used to pay for the current booking.
        electricOrNot - a Boolean value, it is true if the customer chose an electric bike, otherwise it is false.

    • Method Detail

      • getInvoice

        public java.lang.String getInvoice()
        Getter method, it gives back the invoice.
        Returns:
        String

      • printInvoice

        public void printInvoice()
        This method prints out the invoice. The first line is needed to "scale up" all the previous console's output.

      • saveInvoice

        public void saveInvoice()
                 throws java.io.IOException
        This method saves the invoice to a file. The name of the file is standardized:
        • unixtime (when the invoice is created)
        • "_JB_", stands for "JavaBikes"
        • The number of the user's document
        • ".txt", the appropriate extension for a text file
        Throws:
        java.io.IOException
